text: [Music]
well there's a vast number to choose
from and perhaps it's it's worth
emphasizing the arbitrary nature of the
selection
process uh if one's thinking in terms of
billions of past human beings it's uh
extraordinary uh how hard it is to make
a selection and generally the election
has been made for you by previous
historians by posterity by the
contemporaries who built statues or
wrote books about uh famous men and
women and so often one finds oneself
writing about uh people who are already
uh great or evil men or women before you
even show up and I found myself recently
in in a book called The War of the World
writing considerable amount about
Winston chel Joseph Stalin Adolf Hitler
Franklin Roosevelt the stars heroes and
villains of of the 20th century but part
of what I do is to try to to write the
history of non-political Institutions
like firms to look at the history of of
capitalism the history of business and
to give equal billing uh to
entrepreneurs as well as to generals and
politicians because I think the history
of modernity actually requires that
balance to be struck and then you get to
know slightly less familiar figures the
first hero of any book I ever wrote uh
was a German Jewish Banker named Max
vorg or warberg uh who turned into the
hero of my doctoral dissertation rather
to my own surprise simply because as I
rummaged around in archives in Hamburg
trying to understand why Germany had
imploded economically in the 1920s he
kept cropping up and and emerged as the
central uh hero of of of my first book
paper and arm
